verses.kjv: And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took either of them his censer, and put fire therein, and put incense thereon, and offered strange fire before the LORD, which he commanded them not.
verses.ct: Aaron's sons Nadab and Abihu each took his own incense burner, placed burning coals in it, added incense on top, and presented unauthorized fire in the LORD's presence — something he had never instructed them to do.

verses.kjv: And there went out fire from the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.
verses.ct: Fire blazed out from the LORD and consumed them, and they died there in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: Then Moses said unto Aaron, This is it that the LORD spake, saying, I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held his peace.
verses.ct: Moses then told Aaron, "This is what the LORD meant when he said, 'Among those who approach me, I will be treated as holy, and in front of all the people, I will be honored.'" Aaron said nothing.

verses.kjv: And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.
verses.ct: Moses summoned Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Aaron's uncle Uzziel, and told them, "Come here and carry your relatives away from the front of the sanctuary and out of the camp."

verses.kjv: So they went near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said.
verses.ct: So they came forward and carried the bodies out of the camp, still in their tunics, just as Moses had instructed.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.
verses.ct: Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, "Don't leave your hair loose or tear your clothes in grief, or you will die and the LORD's anger will fall on the entire community. But your brothers — the whole nation of Israel — may mourn over the fire the LORD sent."

verses.kjv: And ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
verses.ct: "You must not leave the entrance of the tent of meeting, or you will die, because the LORD's anointing oil is on you." They followed Moses' instructions.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke directly to Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: Do not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations:
verses.ct: "You and your sons must never drink wine or any other alcoholic drink before entering the tent of meeting, or you will die. This is a permanent regulation for every generation that follows you.

verses.kjv: And that ye may put difference between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean;
verses.ct: You must be able to distinguish between what is holy and what is common, and between what is ritually unclean and what is clean.

verses.kjv: And that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.
verses.ct: You are also responsible for teaching the people of Israel all the regulations that the LORD has given them through Moses."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy:
verses.ct: Moses spoke to Aaron and to his surviving sons Eleazar and Ithamar: "Take the grain offering that remains from the LORD's fire offerings and eat it without yeast beside the altar, because it is most holy.

verses.kjv: And ye shall eat it in the holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons’ due, of the sacrifices of the LORD made by fire: for so I am commanded.
verses.ct: You must eat it in the holy area, because it is the share assigned to you and your sons from the LORD's fire offerings. That is what I have been commanded.

verses.kjv: And the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they be thy due, and thy sons’ due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution offering you may eat in any ceremonially clean place — you, your sons, and your daughters together — because these portions have been assigned as the share for you and your children from the peace offerings of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: The heave shoulder and the wave breast shall they bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before the LORD; and it shall be thine, and thy sons’ with thee, by a statute for ever; as the LORD hath commanded.
verses.ct: They are to bring the contribution thigh and the wave breast along with the fire offerings of fat, to present them as a wave offering in the LORD's presence. These will belong to you and your children as a permanent share, just as the LORD has commanded."

verses.kjv: And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron which were left alive, saying,
verses.ct: Moses searched carefully for the goat of the sin offering, and discovered it had been completely burned up. He became angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's surviving sons, and demanded,

verses.kjv: Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin offering in the holy place, seeing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
verses.ct: "Why didn't you eat the sin offering in the holy area? It is most holy, and God gave it to you so you could take on the guilt of the community and make atonement for them in the LORD's presence!

verses.kjv: Behold, the blood of it was not brought in within the holy place: ye should indeed have eaten it in the holy place, as I commanded.
verses.ct: Since its blood was not taken inside the holy area, you absolutely should have eaten it in the holy area, as I instructed."

verses.kjv: And Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD; and such things have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin offering to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of the LORD?
verses.ct: Aaron replied to Moses, "Look, today my sons presented their sin offering and their burnt offering in the LORD's presence, and yet these terrible things have happened to me. If I had eaten the sin offering today, would the LORD really have considered that acceptable?"

verses.kjv: And when Moses heard that, he was content.
verses.ct: When Moses heard this explanation, he accepted it.
